name: DTMF_2021
description:
Update:  28March2021:

Game starts with Title Screen then after the player clicks the screen (mouse our touchscreen) you are greeted with the TIKI SHOP.  The end game will first take you to the GAME ROOM but going to TIKI SHOP for now.

In the Tiki Shop you will see four of the six items (POWER-UPS).  End game this will be a random four items with random prices (I think).  Right now the animations work when you hover over each item but the message board texts are just place holders.  The only item you can click is the HARPOON.

GAME ROOM:  The Recycler and the FISH FOOD are in the GAME ROOM each time and work as intended. 

TODO:  Too much to type right now... lol

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Don’t Touch My Fish is a simple arcade game in which you play as an environmentalist looking to rid the ocean of trash and treasure.  Just make sure to avoid those fish! You have a cash quota to meet at each level.  Use the cash you collect to buy power-ups at your local Tiki Shop but make sure you have enough to meet your goals.

 Power-Ups

Power-Ups can be found or purchased after each level. Prices of every item vary randomly. With the exception of Scissors, the effects of each item wears off after each level.

  • Scissors: Use scissors to cut your line and free accidently caught fish. Scissors are stored until ready to use.
  • Lazer:  Attach this item to your harpoon to show where your spear’s path.
  • Slow-mo: Use this item to slow the fish down
  • Treasure Map:  Reveals the contents of treasure chests
  • Recycler: Use this item to increase the value of trash
  • Lucky Tiki Tile: Increases the chance of getting a good item from the mystery bags.

Trash, Treasure, and Fish

  • Trash:  These items vary in size and type.  Collecting trash is not worth money (unless you have the recycler) but if you collect enough trash then you will get the upgraded harpoon for that level. The bigger the trash the more material you will get for the upgrade but the harder it will be to reel in.    
  • Treasure Chest:  These vary in size and content.  Some Treasure Chests are empty.  The smallest ones are worth 25 and the largest are worth 100.
  • Gems:  These items are small but worth 600.
  • Mystery Bags: Contains random items or money values.
  • Fish:  Fish are fun characters in each level that MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  If you catch a fish then you will lose all the material you need for the upgraded Harpoon.
  • Naval Mines: Hitting these will kill nearby fish as well as destroy any nearby trash or treasure.  Like the fish, you should avoid these as much as possible.
